page.title: 04PLACE NAMES 2
page.content: mentioned,but with the name {Lertington.}By 1184 it was {Lyrtington,}and in 1252 it was {Lirtington.}The_ing means a clan or family and in this case Lyrta or Lyrti was the family.'Ton' comes from_Tun and means an enclosure farmstead. Thus in this case the name means the settlement of the people of Lyrti. {Dale}comes from the word Dael, meaning valley. The valley is very deep, hence the name. {Beck}is from 'Bekka'. Hence Deepdale Beck means the stream in the deep valley. A{Park}is the usual word used to describe an area used for hunting. In this case Deerbolt Park seems likely that deer were hunted here. {Grise}comes from the old norse 'Griss'meaning a pig or boar. Thus grise Beck means the pigs watering
